title: This is the top Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Buffalo chicken dip is the most-searched Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness analysis.
The dish ranks as the top Super Bowl snack in 31 states, highlighting its national popularity.
Pico de gallo is the most-searched healthy Super Bowl snack option in Massachusetts.

title: Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’
author: John Waller
bullets: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt supports Patriots for Super Bowl LX, expressing her New Hampshire roots.
President Donald Trump has chosen not to make a prediction for the upcoming Super Bowl LX game.
Trump will be interviewed by Tom Llamas for NBC News before the Super Bowl begins.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: Snowfall totals in eastern Massachusetts expected to be 4-6 inches with heavier bands possible midday Saturday.
Coastal areas may receive 3-6 inches of snow, with localized ocean effect snow causing variability in amounts.
Snowfall could start late Friday night, tapering off Saturday evening, with widespread 2-4 inches expected across southern New England.

title: Think you know the Patriots’ Super Bowl history? Take the quiz.
author: Kelly Chan and Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Patriots are facing the Seattle Seahawks in the Super Bowl on Sunday.
A quiz tests fans' knowledge of the Patriots' Super Bowl history, including the 2017 comeback win.
Tom Brady celebrated his fifth Lombardi Trophy in 2017 after a historic comeback from a 28-3 deficit.

title: Patriots star Christian Gonzalez has a big fan in Bruins legend Zdeno Chara
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' cornerback Christian Gonzalez wears shirts honoring Boston legends, including Zdeno Chara, before games.
Gonzalez's tribute to Chara was appreciated by the Bruins legend as he closely follows Patriots' playoff run.
Gonzalez has excelled in the postseason, allowing just 39.3% completion on 28 targeted passes.

title: Inside the origin of the Patriots’ ‘road warriors’ rallying cry
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots have embraced the 'Road Warriors' mantra, going 9-0 in road games this season.
Head coach Mike Vrabel used clips from 'The Road Warriors' and 'The Warriors' to motivate and entertain players.
Patriots opted for road whites for Super Bowl LX, despite being the designated home team at Levi's Stadium.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of recent Greater Boston news stories.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com editor since 2019, oversees the creation of local news quizzes.
The quiz focuses on trending news topics in the Greater Boston region as of February 2026.

title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame during the NFL Honors ceremony in San Francisco.
Vinatieri is the NFL's all-time scoring leader with 2,673 points and three-time All-Pro selection.
He played 24 seasons for the Patriots and Colts, winning four Super Bowls and making crucial game-winning kicks.

title: Drake Maye loses MVP award to Matthew Stafford by razor-thin margin
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots QB Drake Maye finished second in MVP voting, one first-place vote behind Rams QB Matthew Stafford.
Matthew Stafford received 24 first-place votes, totaling 366 points, while Drake Maye secured 23 votes, resulting in 361 points.
Drake Maye led the Patriots to a 14-3 record, posting 4,394 passing yards, 31 touchdowns, and a league-leading 72.0% completion rate.

title: Mike Vrabel named 2025 NFL Coach of the Year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel wins 2025 NFL Coach of the Year after leading Patriots to Super Bowl LX.
This is Vrabel's second Coach of the Year award, the first was with the Tennessee Titans in 2021.
Patriots achieved a 17-3 record under Vrabel, marking a turnaround from back-to-back four-win seasons.
